thread.title: Two hospitalized after drive-by shooting on Brooklyn street
thread.title_full: Two hospitalized after drive-by shooting on Brooklyn street - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Two hospitalized after drive-by shooting on Brooklyn street
text:
A drive-by shooting in Brooklyn sent two people to the hospital, police said Thursday.
A gunman fired several shots from his car as he stopped in front of a building on Hendrix St. near Sutter Ave. in East New York just before 2 p.m. Wednesday, cops said.
One bullet struck Jason Garrett, 23, in the left arm, and another tore through the left leg of a 25-year-old woman identified only as Channel, according to police.
The gunman fled south on Hendrix St. in a tan Honda minivan, officials said.
Brooklyn gunman shoots 15-year-old in head, 18-year-old in leg 
Police on the scene where two people were shot outside of a building on Hendrix St. near Sutter Ave. in East New York Wednesday. (Todd Maisel/New York Daily News) EMS workers took both victims to Brookdale Hospital to be treated for their wounds, cops said. They are both expected to survive.
Cops on Thursday released surveillance video of the car, and are asking the publicâ€™s help finding the shooter.
Anyone with information is asked to call CrimeStoppers at (800) 577-TIPS.
